title: Can Trump counter years of "inefficient" action against Nigeria's insurgents? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump is threatening Nigeria with potential military action, accusing the country's government of enabling the religious persecution of Christians. The Nigerian president has pushed back against the claims, reaffirming the nation's "constitutional guarantees to protect citizens of all faiths", while a spokesperson says it welcomes US assistance in fighting extremist groups like Boko Haram. Nigerian human rights lawyer Ayodele Sogunro tells The World while Christians have been killed in the country, they are not being specifically targeted because they are Christian. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Pro-Palestinian protesters and police clash outside defence expo in Sydney | ABC NEWS
description: Multiple people have been arrested as police and Pro-Palestinian protesters clashed outside a maritime expo at the International Convention Centre in Sydney’s Darling Harbour. Demonstrators described the three-day Indo Pacific International Maritime Exposition as an arms convention, accusing participating companies such as the Elbit and the Rafael weapon systems of being complicit in the war in Gaza. title: UK train stabbing suspect Anthony Williams charged with 10 counts of attempted murder | ABC NEWS
description: A 32-year-old British man has been charged with 10 counts of attempted murder after multiple people were stabbed on a train bound for London from Doncaster. The accused, Anthony Williams, made a brief court appearance. title: Destructive winds tear through southern Queensland | ABC NEWS
description: The Weather Bureau says conditions are set to ease across Queensland after severe thunderstorms with destructive winds battered the state’s south. A series of violent storm systems also tore through the state over the weekend, causing widespread hail damage. title: Alan Kohler on why we need 117,000 more tradies | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    There’s been hope of a November interest rate cut to coincide with the Melbourne Cup for months, but with inflation rising again, it seems all bets are off.   What have the three rate cuts already granted this year done to house prices?    Today, ABC finance commentator Alan Kohler looks at what’s happening in the market and how immigration policies have left Australia with rising demand for housing and not enough tradies to construct them.    Featured:    Alan Kohler, ABC finance presenter and columnist

title: How Tasmania's salmon industry failed its fish | ABC News
description: A review of a mass fish death event in Tasmania's salmon industry shows the industry was too slow to react. A bacterial disease - known as P.salmonis rickettsia — caused the deaths of an estimated 10 tonnes of salmon in pens in south-east Tasmanian waters from January to April  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here:  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Mouse population set to surge in some of Australia’s key crop regions | ABC NEWS
description: Farmers are being urged to prepare to bait for mice as the CSIRO warn mouse population could surge in 2026. CSIRO research officer Steve Henry discusses the findings of the study and says the Yorke Peninsula and Adelaide Plains were areas that’s likely to be most affected by mouse plague. title: Easey Street Murders: Conflicting memories as witnesses give evidence | The Case Of...
description: Neighbours on Easey Street have given evidence along with a former homicide detective, in the second day of the committal hearing for accused killer Perry Kouroumblis. In this episode, ABC reporter Alexandra Alvaro joins Stephen Stockwell to talk through the key moments in court, including hints at the other men in the picture that Perry Kouroumblis's defence team have focused on.  They also answer your questions about the layout of the house and how the media 'lawyered up' to report the entirety of these proceedings. If you have any questions you'd like Alex, Rachael or Stocky to answer in future episodes, please email thecaseof@abc.net.au (mailto:thecaseof@abc.net.au) .  The Case Of is the follow-up to the hit podcast Mushroom Case Daily, and all episodes of that show will remain available in the back catalogue of The Case Of.

title: Medieval tower partially collapses near Rome's Colosseum | ABC NEWS
description: A medieval tower near the Colosseum in Rome has collapsed during a restoration project, trapping one worker and seriously injuring another.  The Torre dei Conti, collapsed further when first responders attempted to rescue the Romanian workers, but none of the firefighters was injured.  The historic building, which was built in the 13th Century by Pope Innocent III, was due to be converted into a museum and conference space. title: IDF's ex-top lawyer arrested over video leak showing alleged abuse of jailed Palestinian | ABC NEWS
description: The Israeli military's former chief prosecutor has been arrested after she admitted to leaking a damning video that appears to show Israeli army reservists abusing a Palestinian detainee at the Sde Teiman military detention facility in the Negev Desert. Five reservists were charged with aggravated abuse and causing serious bodily harm to the detainee. Major General Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi was found on a beach in Tel Aviv after reports of her going missing sparked an air and sea search. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has labelled the video the most ‘damaging propaganda attack’ in Israel’s history. title: 268kg of drugs seized, 18 people charged after multi-force investigation | ABC NEWS
description: NSW Police along with officers from WA and the AFP have charged 18 people and seized 268 kilograms of illicit drugs, including methamphetamine, ketamine and cocaine, after an investigation as part of Strike Force Bloomfield. Police allege members of a national syndicate imported the drugs via sea and concealed them in consignments of shoes and plastics before the drugs and money were exchanged across borders in the mail and by drug mules on planes. Cash and firearms were also seized after warrants were executed in NSW and WA between May and October. title: Calls for footy clubs to divest from pokies with more than $110 million lost to machines | ABC News
description: More than $110 million was lost to pokie machines in venues owned by Victorian football clubs and leagues — from AFL down to local level — in 2024/25.  The figure has prompted condemnation from gambling harm advocates, who say it is "hypocrisy" for football clubs to be cornerstones of their communities, while profiting from gambling harm.  Stateline by Harrison Tippet for ABC News Victoria   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://shorturl.at/XDupF  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Earthquake kills at least 20, damages Blue Mosque in Afghanistan | ABC NEWS
description: Afghan authorities are expecting the death toll to rise from a magnitude 6.3 earthquake in the country's north.  The disaster, which struck near Mazar-e-Sharif, killed at least 20 people and injured more than 600 others.  The city's historic Blue Mosque was also damaged. The United Nations has deployed ground teams to assist in clean-up efforts. title: Jamaicans await help as communities face challenging clean-up | ABC NEWS
description: Communities in Jamaica are still waiting for aid days after Hurricane Melissa hit as a category five system. Farmer Keith Wedderburn is from the Belmont district which was one of the worst hit areas. He discusses the difficult clean-up process in the region. title: Sydney mother recalls panic after son sent home from daycare with the wrong person | ABC NEWS
description: Sydney mother Sophie Tilley says a childcare centre mistakenly handed her son to another child's grandfather. Ms Tilley says she is in therapy and still deeply affected by the incident, and questions why the investigation has not been finalised. First Steps Learning Academy says it takes its responsibilities seriously and always strives to meet its standards and those of the regulator.
